activities: Personal information is received from the EU regarding prospective, current and former employees.  In addition, in connection with the delivery of forensic and litigation consulting, personal information is received from the EU on behalf of clients, prospective clients and their respective personnel and customers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-line, Off-line, Manually Processed, Human Resource
recoursemech: If the complaint involves data collected in the context of an employment relationship, we will cooperate with the relevant EU data protection authorities (DPAs) or Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC). In the event that we or such authorities determine that we did not comply with our data protection legal obligations, we will take appropriate steps to address any adverse effects and to promote future compliance.  If the dispute involves data that we collected or received from or on behalf of a client, then the terms of the relevant engagement letter or contract will govern resolution of the issue.  For all other matters the American Arbitration Association (AAA) shall govern.
